title: Peter Stormonth Darling, financier who led Mercury Asset Management as it grew to be the City’s largest fund manager – obituary
text:
Peter Stormonth Darling, who has died aged 86, was chairman of Mercury Asset Management, the investment arm of the Warburg banking empire.

Stormonth Darling was a director of the business that began as Warburg Investment Management in 1969 through its zenith as MAM, the City’s largest fund manager, to its last day as an independent company in 1998, when it was acquired by Merrill Lynch.

In 1979 he was appointed chairman – with the discouraging instruction from his long-time mentor, the brilliant but idiosyncratic financier Siegmund Warburg, “Your first task, Peter, is to get rid of it. I don’t care what you get for it. You can give it away.”

Siegmund proceeded to offer the business for nothing...
